proposed_strategy.name: Single Unit Chunking
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided document segment (Panchama Prashna with commentary) is small enough to be processed as a single chunk, maximizing efficiency while respecting the safety character limit.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Fifth Prashna (Mantra 1 through 7) and its Prakashika commentary.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Prashna is structurally divided into seven sequentially numbered Mantras/verses, each followed immediately by its commentary (Prakashika). Parsing by Mantra isolates the core semantic units.

start_pattern.description: The start of a new Mūla Mantra, identified by the bold text immediately followed by the closing Devanagari numeral enclosed in double bars.
examples: **ऋग्भिरेतं यजुर्भिरन्तरिक्षं सामभिर्यत्तत् कवयो वेदयन्ते । तमोंकारेणैवायतनेनान्वेति विद्वान् यत्तच्छान्तमजरममृतमभयं परं चेति ।। ७ ।।**

end_pattern.description: The parsing unit ends implicitly right before the start pattern of the next Mantra, or explicitly at the Prashna conclusion marker.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial lines identifying the Upanishad, the Prashna number, and the sub-heading (e.g., [प्रणवोपासना]) should be treated as metadata for the entire chunk.
